StringListProperty.Name: AdditionalIncludeDirectories
StringListProperty.Description: Specifies one or more directories to add to the include path. Separate with ';' if more than one. (/I[path])

BoolProperty.Name: ScanSourceForModuleDependencies
BoolProperty.Description: Makes the build scan all c++ sources, not just module interface and header unit sources, for module and header units dependencies and build the full dependencies graph.

EnumProperty.Name: DebugInformationFormat
EnumProperty.Description: Specifies the type of debugging information generated by the compiler. This requires compatible linker settings. (/Z7, /Zi, /ZI)

EnumValue.Name: None
EnumValue.Description: Produces no debugging information, so compilation may be faster.

EnumValue.Name: OldStyle
EnumValue.Description: Select the type of debugging information created for your program and whether this information is kept in object (.obj) files or in a program database (PDB).

EnumValue.Name: ProgramDatabase
EnumValue.Description: Produces a program database (PDB) that contains type information and symbolic debugging information for use with the debugger. The symbolic debugging information includes the names and types of variables, as well as functions and line numbers.

EnumValue.Name: EditAndContinue
EnumValue.DisplayName: Program Database for Edit And Continue
EnumValue.Description: Produces a program database, as described above, in a format that supports the Edit and Continue feature.

BoolProperty.Name: SupportJustMyCode
BoolProperty.Description: Adds supporting code for enabling Just My Code debugging in this compilation unit. (/JMC)

BoolProperty.Name: SuppressStartupBanner
BoolProperty.Description: Suppresses the display of the sign-on banner when the compiler starts up and display of informational messages during compiling.

EnumProperty.Name: WarningLevel
EnumProperty.Description: Select how strict you want the compiler to be about code errors. (/W0 - /W4)

EnumValue.Name: Level1
EnumValue.Description: Level 1 displays severe warnings. Level 1 is the default warning level at the command line.

EnumValue.Name: Level2
EnumValue.Description: Level 2 displays all level 1 warnings and warnings less severe than level 1.

EnumValue.Name: Level3
EnumValue.Description: Level 3 displays all level 2 warnings and all other warnings recommended for production purposes.

EnumValue.Name: Level4
EnumValue.Description: Level 4 displays all level 3 warnings plus informational warnings, which in most cases can be safely ignored.

EnumValue.Name: EnableAllWarnings
EnumValue.Description: Enables all warnings, including those disabled by default.

BoolProperty.Name: TreatWarningAsError
BoolProperty.Description: Treats all compiler warnings as errors. For a new project, it may be best to use /WX in all compilations; resolving all warnings will ensure the fewest possible hard-to-find code defects.

StringProperty.Name: WarningVersion
StringProperty.Description: Hide warnings introduced after a specific version of the compiler. (/Wv:xx[.yy[.zzzzz]])

EnumProperty.Name: DiagnosticsFormat
EnumProperty.Description: Enables rich diagnostics, with column information and source context in diagnostic messages.

EnumValue.Name: Caret
EnumValue.Description: Provides column information in the diagnostic message, as well as outputting the relevant line of source code with a caret indicating the offending column.

EnumValue.Name: Column
EnumValue.Description: Additionally provides the column number within the line where the diagnostic is issued, where applicable.

EnumValue.Name: Classic
EnumValue.Description: Retains the prior, concise diagnostic messages with the line number.

BoolProperty.Name: MultiProcessorCompilation
BoolProperty.Description: Multi-processor Compilation.

BoolProperty.Name: EnableASAN
BoolProperty.Description: Compiles and links program with AddressSanitizer. Currently available for x86 and x64 builds.

EnumProperty.Name: Optimization
EnumProperty.Description: Select option for code optimization; choose Custom to use specific optimization options. (/Od, /O1, /O2)

EnumProperty.Name: InlineFunctionExpansion
EnumProperty.Description: Select the level of inline function expansion for the build. (/Ob1, /Ob2)

EnumValue.Name: Disabled
EnumValue.Description: Disables inline expansion, which is on by default.

EnumValue.Name: OnlyExplicitInline
EnumValue.Description: Expands only functions marked as inline, __inline, __forceinline or __inline or, in a C++ member function, defined within a class declaration.

EnumValue.Name: AnySuitable
EnumValue.Description: Expands functions marked as inline or __inline and any other function that the compiler chooses (expansion occurs at the compiler's discretion, often referred to as auto-inlining).

BoolProperty.Name: IntrinsicFunctions
BoolProperty.Description: Enables intrinsic functions. Using intrinsic functions generates faster, but possibly larger, code. (/Oi)

EnumProperty.Name: FavorSizeOrSpeed
EnumProperty.Description: Whether to favor code size or code speed; 'Global Optimization' must be turned on. (/Ot, /Os)

EnumValue.Name: Size
EnumValue.Description: Favor Small Code. Minimizes the size of EXEs and DLLs by instructing the compiler to favor size over speed.

EnumValue.Name: Speed
EnumValue.Description: Favor Fast Code. Maximizes the speed of EXEs and DLLs by instructing the compiler to favor speed over size. (This is the default.)

BoolProperty.Name: OmitFramePointers
BoolProperty.Description: Suppresses creation of frame pointers on the call stack.

BoolProperty.Name: EnableFiberSafeOptimizations
BoolProperty.Description: Enables memory space optimization when using fibers and thread local storage access. (/GT)

StringListProperty.Name: PreprocessorDefinitions
StringListProperty.Description: Defines a preprocessing symbols for your source file.

StringListProperty.Name: UndefinePreprocessorDefinitions
StringListProperty.Description: Specifies one or more preprocessor undefines. (/U[macro])

BoolProperty.Name: UndefineAllPreprocessorDefinitions
BoolProperty.Description: Undefine all previously defined preprocessor values. (/u)

BoolProperty.Name: PreprocessToFile
BoolProperty.Description: Preprocesses C and C++ source files and writes the preprocessed output to a file. This option suppresses compilation, thus it does not produce an .obj file.

StringProperty.Name: PreprocessOutputPath
StringProperty.Description: Specify the output path for the preprocesser. The default location is the same as the source file(s).

BoolProperty.Name: PreprocessSuppressLineNumbers
BoolProperty.Description: Preprocess without #line directives.

BoolProperty.Name: PreprocessKeepComments
BoolProperty.Description: Suppresses comment strip from source code; requires that one of the 'Preprocessing' options be set. (/C)

BoolProperty.Name: StringPooling
BoolProperty.Description: Enables the compiler to create a single read-only copy of identical strings in the program image and in memory during execution, resulting in smaller programs, an optimization called string pooling. /O1, /O2, and /ZI automatically set /GF option.

EnumProperty.Name: ExceptionHandling
EnumProperty.Description: Specifies the model of exception handling to be used by the compiler.

EnumValue.Name: Async
EnumValue.Description: The exception-handling model that catches asynchronous (structured) and synchronous (C++) exceptions. (/EHa)

EnumValue.Name: Sync
EnumValue.Description: The exception-handling model that catches C++ exceptions only and tells the compiler to assume that extern C functions never throw a C++ exception. (/EHsc)

EnumValue.Name: SyncCThrow
EnumValue.Description: The exception-handling model that catches C++ exceptions only and tells the compiler to assume that extern C functions do throw an exception. (/EHs)

BoolProperty.Name: SmallerTypeCheck
BoolProperty.Description: Enable checking for conversion to smaller types, incompatible with any optimization type other than debug. (/RTCc)

EnumValue.Name: MultiThreaded
EnumValue.Description: Causes your application to use the multithread, static version of the run-time library.

EnumValue.Name: MultiThreadedDebug
EnumValue.Description: Defines _DEBUG and _MT. This option also causes the compiler to place the library name LIBCMTD.lib into the .obj file so that the linker will use LIBCMTD.lib to resolve external symbols.

EnumValue.Name: MultiThreadedDLL
EnumValue.Description: Causes your application to use the multithread- and DLL-specific version of the run-time library. Defines _MT and _DLL and causes the compiler to place the library name MSVCRT.lib into the .obj file.

EnumValue.Name: MultiThreadedDebugDLL
EnumValue.Description: Defines _DEBUG, _MT, and _DLL and causes your application to use the debug multithread- and DLL-specific version of the run-time library. It also causes the compiler to place the library name MSVCRTD.lib into the .obj file.

EnumProperty.Name: StructMemberAlignment
EnumProperty.Description: Specifies 1, 2, 4, 8, or 16-byte boundaries for struct member alignment. (/Zp[num])

EnumValue.Name: 1Byte
EnumValue.Description: Packs structures on 1-byte boundaries. Same as /Zp.

EnumProperty.Name: BufferSecurityCheck
EnumProperty.Description: The Security Check helps detect stack-buffer over-runs, a common attempted attack upon a program's security. . (/GS-, /GS)

EnumProperty.Name: ControlFlowGuard
EnumProperty.Description: Guard security check helps detect attempts to dispatch to illegal block of code. (/guard:cf)

BoolProperty.Name: FunctionLevelLinking
BoolProperty.Description: Allows the compiler to package individual functions in the form of packaged functions (COMDATs). Required for edit and continue to work. (/Gy)

EnumProperty.Name: EnableEnhancedInstructionSet
EnumProperty.Description: Enable use of instructions found on processors that support enhanced instruction sets. If no option is specified, the compiler will use instructions found on processors that support SSE2. Use of enhanced instructions can be disabled with /arch:IA32. (/arch:SSE, /arch:SSE2, /arch:AVX, /arch:AVX2, /arch:AVX512, /arch:IA32, /arch:ARMv7VE, /arch:VFPv4, /arch:[armv8.0-armv8.8],)

EnumValue.Name: Precise
EnumValue.Description: Default. Improves the consistency of floating-point tests for equality and inequality.

EnumValue.Name: Strict
EnumValue.Description: The strictest floating-point model. /fp:strict causes fp_contract to be OFF and fenv_access to be ON. /fp:except is implied and can be disabled by explicitly specifying /fp:except-. When used with /fp:except-, /fp:strict enforces strict floating-point semantics but without respect for exceptional events.

EnumValue.Name: Fast
EnumValue.Description: Creates the fastest code in the majority of cases.

BoolProperty.Name: FloatingPointExceptions
BoolProperty.Description: Reliable floating-point exception model. Exceptions will be raised immediately after they are triggered. (/fp:except)

BoolProperty.Name: IntelJCCErratum
BoolProperty.Description: Software mitigation for the performance impact caused by the Intel JCC erratum microcode update. (/QIntel-jcc-erratum)

BoolProperty.Name: GuardEHContMetadata
BoolProperty.Description: Generates a sorted list of all the valid exception handling continuation targets for a binary, used during runtime for RIP validation. Currently available for x64 builds. (/guard:ehcont)

BoolProperty.Name: RuntimeTypeInfo
BoolProperty.Description: Adds code for checking C++ object types at run time (runtime type information). (/GR, /GR-)

EnumProperty.Name: LanguageStandard
EnumProperty.Description: Determines the C++ language standard the compiler will enforce. It is recommended to use the latest version when possible. (/std:c++14, /std:c++17, /std:c++20, /std:c++latest)

EnumValue.Name: stdcpplatest
EnumValue.DisplayName: Preview - Features from the Latest C++ Working Draft

EnumProperty.Name: LanguageStandard_C
EnumProperty.Description: Determines the C language standard the compiler will enforce. It is recommended to use the latest version when possible. (/std:c11, /std:c17, /std:clatest)

EnumValue.Name: stdclatest
EnumValue.DisplayName: Preview - Features from the Latest C Working Draft

BoolProperty.Name: BuildStlModules
BoolProperty.DisplayName: Build ISO C++23 Standard Library Modules
BoolProperty.Description: Enables automatic build of std and std.compat modules when using /std:c++latest.

EnumProperty.Name: PrecompiledHeader
EnumProperty.Description: Create/Use Precompiled Header : Enables creation or use of a precompiled header during the build. (/Yc, /Yu)

EnumValue.Name: Create
EnumValue.Description: Instructs the compiler to create a precompiled header (.pch) file that represents the state of compilation at a certain point.

EnumValue.Name: Use
EnumValue.Description: Instructs the compiler to use an existing precompiled header (.pch) file in the current compilation.

StringProperty.Name: PrecompiledHeaderFile
StringProperty.Description: Specifies header file name to use when creating or using a precompiled header file. (/Yc[name], /Yu[name])

StringProperty.Name: PrecompiledHeaderOutputFile
StringProperty.Description: Specifies the path and/or name of the generated precompiled header file. (/Fp[name])

EnumProperty.Name: AssemblerOutput
EnumProperty.Description: Specifies the contents of assembly language output file. (/FA, /FAc, /FAs, /FAcs)

EnumValue.Name: All
EnumValue.Description: Assembly, machine code and source code; .cod

StringProperty.Name: AssemblerListingLocation
StringProperty.Description: Specifies relative path and/or name for ASM listing file; can be file or directory name. (/Fa[name])

StringProperty.Name: ObjectFileName
StringProperty.Description: Specifies a name to override the default object file name; can be file or directory name. (/Fo[name])

EnumProperty.Name: CallingConvention
EnumProperty.Description: Select the default calling convention for your application (can be overridden by function). (/Gd, /Gr, /Gz, /Gv)

EnumValue.Name: Cdecl
EnumValue.Description: Specifies the __cdecl calling convention for all functions except C++ member functions and functions marked __stdcall or __fastcall.

EnumValue.Name: FastCall
EnumValue.Description: Specifies the __fastcall calling convention for all functions except C++ member sfunctions and functions marked __cdecl or __stdcall. All __fastcall functions must have prototypes.

EnumValue.Name: StdCall
EnumValue.Description: Specifies the __stdcall calling convention for all functions except C++ member functions and functions marked __cdecl or __fastcall. All __stdcall functions must have prototypes.

EnumValue.Name: VectorCall
EnumValue.Description: Specifies the __vectorcall calling convention for all functions except C++ member functions and functions marked __cdecl, __fastcall, or __stdcall. All __vectorcall functions must have prototypes.

EnumProperty.Name: CompileAs
EnumProperty.Description: Select compile language option for .c and .cpp files. (/TC, /TP, /interface, /internalPartition, /exportHeader)

EnumValue.Name: CompileAsCppModuleInternalPartition
EnumValue.DisplayName: Compile as C++ Module Internal Partition
EnumValue.Description: Compile as C++ Module Internal Partition.

StringListProperty.Name: ForcedIncludeFiles
StringListProperty.Description: one or more forced include files. (/FI[name])

BoolProperty.Name: ShowIncludes
BoolProperty.Description: Generates a list of include files with compiler output. (/showIncludes)

BoolProperty.Name: OmitDefaultLibName
BoolProperty.Description: Do not include default library names in .obj files. (/Zl)
